com.quinsoft.zeidon.domains

Interface Domain

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    TableDomain
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDomain, AbstractNumericDomain, AbstractTableDomain, Argon2PasswordDomain, Base64BlobDomain, BigDecimalDomain, BlobDomain, BooleanDomain, CaseAwareStringDomain, CreatedDateTimeDomain, DateDomain, DateTimeDomain, DoubleDomain, DynamicTableDomain, EmailAddressDomain, GeneratedKeyDomain, IntegerDomain, LongDomain, PasswordDomain, PhoneDomain, RegularExpressionDomain, SSNDomain, StaticTableDomain, StringDomain, TimeDomain, UuidDomain

    public interface Domain
    Interface for all domains.

    DG

      • convertExternalValue

        Object convertExternalValue(Task task,
                            AttributeInstance attributeInstance,
                            AttributeDef attributeDef,
                            String contextName,
                            Object externalValue)
                     throws InvalidAttributeValueException
        Takes an external value and converts it into a value used internally value using domain processing.
        Parameters:
        task - Zeidon task
        attributeInstance - If not null, the is the target attribute. May be null; this can happen when converting a value to be used in generated SQL.
        attributeDef - AttributeDef of value being converted.
        contextName - - Context name.
        externalValue - - External value
        Returns:
        internal value.
        Throws:
        InvalidAttributeValueException

      • convertValueForDb

        Object convertValueForDb(Task task,
                         AttributeDef attributeDef,
                         Object value)
        Converts a value to be used with the DB. By default this just returns value.
        Parameters:
        task - Zeidon task
        attributeDef - AttributeDef of value being converted.
        value - value
        Returns:
        value usable by DB.

      • convertInternalValue

        Object convertInternalValue(Task task,
                            AttributeInstance attributeInstance,
                            Object value)
                     throws InvalidAttributeValueException
        Takes a value that is an internal value but may may be of a different type and converts it into an internal value data type. This is used when setting the attribute value from the DB. Normally this method is the same as convertExternalValue but some domains require different conversion algorithms. For example, the PasswordDomain normally encrypts an external string but when loaded from the DB the encrypting is not necessary.
        Parameters:
        task -
        attributeInstance - TODO
        value -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        InvalidAttributeValueException

      • compare

        int compare(Task task,
            AttributeInstance attributeInstance,
            AttributeDef attributeDef,
            Object internalValue,
            Object externalValue)
        Compares an external value to an internal attribute value.
        Parameters:
        task -
        attributeInstance - If not null, the is the target attribute. May be null; this can happen when converting a value to be used in generated SQL.
        attributeDef - TODO
        internalValue - - Internal attribute value.
        externalValue -
        Returns:
        -1 if o1 < o2 0 if o1 = o2 1 if o1 > o2

      • generateRandomTestValue

        Object generateRandomTestValue(Task task,
                               AttributeDef attributeDef,
                               EntityInstance entityInstance)
        Generate a random test value for this domain. This is used by test code to create random test data.
        Parameters:
        task - current task
        attributeDef - def of the attribute.
        entityInstance - if not null this is the EntityInstance that will store the test data.
        Returns:
        random test data for this domain.

      • hasInitialValue

        boolean hasInitialValue(Task task,
                        AttributeDef attributeDef)
        Returns true if this domain has an initial value for the specified attribute. Will only be called if the attribute does not have its own initial value.
        Parameters:
        task -
        attributeDef -
        Returns:
